p: T. bellirica fruits were purchased from local market of Allahabad and identification was confirmed by Prof. D. K. Chauhan (Department of Botany, University of Allahabad). The fruits were shade dried at room temperature for 10â€“15 days, ground into a fine powder and extracted sequentially with ethyl acetate and water using the Soxhlet apparatus [ 29]. The excess amount of solvent in extracts was removed under reduced pressure. The total yield in Eth and AQ extracts was 4.5 % and 23 %, respectively. The extracts were further dissolved in respective solvents for the determination of antioxidant, anti-inflammatory and hepatoprotective activities.
